turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: It'll be fine, yeah.

turns.speaker: MRS. MORALES
turns.text: Ai, bueno.  Because I didn't want to tell you before, with your worries --

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MRS. MORALES
turns.text: My daughter, she's bought a big house with a room for me.  I'm going to move in with her.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: You're moving away?  When?

turns.speaker: MRS. MORALES
turns.text: Next week.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Wow, that's soon --

turns.speaker: MRS. MORALES
turns.text: I know.  But it's good for me.  Now I can help my daughter take care of my grandkids. And it's good for you, too.  Now you have money, you can find a good babysitter, huh? Not the old lady next door.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Dr. Paulsen?

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Hi, I'm Erin Brockovich.  I was just over in the library there, asking a mess of questions about -- I guess they call it epidemiology? -- and the fella there told me to find you, cause you know all about it.

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: Is this a joke?  Did Baxter put you up to this?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Who's Baxter?

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: He did, didn't he?  <u>Baxter</u>!

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: Oh.  Oh.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: No one put me up to anything.  I was just hoping I could ask you a couple questions.

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: Of course!  Oh, gosh, of course --

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: Well, look, there isn't a ton of information here, but from what there is, I'd say that these two people here -- what are their names?  Shanna and Ashley?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Right, I guess those are the kids --

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: They've both got some immune system problem. Can't say what from, whether it's viral or genetic or what, but something's wrong.  And these guys -- Donna and Peter --

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Their parents, I'm pretty sure.

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: Well, from what this stuff says, I'd say they both have some form of cancer.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: ... and when I realized our area's just as bad as Hinkley, I thought maybe my neighbors are all sick too.  So I went and asked.

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: You did?

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Uh-huh.  Spent the last few days knocking on doors.  And you know what?  They're not.  I mean, they got problems, but none of this cancer stuff.  And their pets are fine.  So I don't know -- I just can't shake the feeling that it wasn't no multivitamin they put in the water.

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: Well, if you're talking about contamination, you're getting out of my area of expertise. Let me give you the name of a toxicologist friend of mine over at USC.

turns.speaker: PAULSEN
turns.text: I gotta say, Erin -- first time I saw you, I did not peg you as the kind to go off and conduct her own epidemiological study.

turns.speaker: ERIN
turns.text: Don't go telling anyone.  It'll ruin my reputation.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL
turns.text: It was .... the Emperor ....

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: The Emperor?

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL
turns.text: Yes, he commands you make contact with him ....

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Move this ship out of the asteroid field and into a position where we can send a clear transmission.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL
turns.text: Yes, My Lord.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: And code the signal to my private chamber.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL PIETT
turns.text: My lord.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Come in, Admiral.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL PIETT
turns.text: Our pursuit ships have sighted the Millennium Falcon, My Lord.  It has entered an asteroid field.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Asteroids don't concern me, Admiral. I want that ship, not excuses.  How long until you can have Skywalker and the others in the Millennium Falcon before me?

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL PIETT
turns.text: Soon, Lord Vader.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Yes, Admiral .... soon.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL PIETT
turns.text: Lord Vader, our ships have completed their scan of the area and found nothing.  The Millennium Falcon definitely went into lightspeed. It's probably on the other side of the galaxy by now.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Alert all commands.  Calculate every possible destination along their last known trajectory and disburse the fleet to search for them.  Don't fail me again, Admiral, I've had quite enough!

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL PIETT
turns.text: Yes, My Lord.  We'll find them.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: He will learn patience.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: Much anger in him, like in his father.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: We've discussed this before.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: He can do it.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: This one I have watched a long time.  All his life has he looked away ... to the horizon, to the sky, to the future.  Never his mind on where he was, on what he was doing.  Adventure, excitement ...  A Jedi craves not these things!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: He'll learn.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: He's too old.  Yes.  Too old to start the training.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: Will he finish what he begins?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: We've come this far ... He is our only hope.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: Stopped they must be.  Do you hear?  On this all depends.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You are the last Jedi, Luke.  You are our only hope.  Be patient.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Luke, use The Force only for knowledge and for defense, not as a weapon.  Don't give in to hate or anger or fear ... they lead the way to the dark side ... Luke nods and climbs back into his ship.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: Strong is Vader.  Clouded is your fate.  Mind what you have learned ... Notice everything, everything!  It can save you.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: Told you, I did.  Reckless is he ... Now things are going to worse.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The boy is our last hope.

turns.speaker: YODA
turns.text: No ... there is another.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I can't ...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You must.  Luke, look at me!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You must survive, Luke.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm cold ... so cold ...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You must go to the Dagobah System ... There you will learn from one who taught me:  Yoda, the Jedi Master.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Ben ... Ben ...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Luke ... you are the only hope.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: ... Luke, you must not go.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But Han and Leia will surely die.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You don't know that.  Even I cannot see their fate.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I can help them!

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You're not ready yet.  You still have much to learn.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I feel The Force.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: But you cannot control it.  This is a dangerous time for you, Luke. You are now most susceptible to the temptations of the dark side.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Will you?  You underestimate The Emperor.  It is you he wants ... that is why your friends suffer.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: And that is why I must go.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Luke, I will not lose you to the Emperor, as I lost Vader.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You won't.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Only a fully trained Jedi Knight, with The Force as his ally, will conquer Vader and his Emperor. If you end your training now, if you choose the quick and easy path ... as Vader did ... you will become an agent of evil ... and the galaxy will be plunged deeper into the abyss of hate, despair and pain that you feel your friends suffering now.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: How you doing, Chewbacca?  Still wasting your time with this clown, eh?

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Growls a reserved greeting.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks at the mention of food. Licks his lips.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: Everyone's invited, of course.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks a blue streak.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: Three patrol ships are heading our way.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks an argument and shakes his head.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Turns on Lando, the newcomer, with an ominous growl.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: Okay, okay.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Howls.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: We're not out of this yet.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Well, it's been awhile.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks and growls at his boss.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That was a long time ago.  I'm sure he's forgotten all about it, and so should you.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Howls and shrugs his shoulders.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Why don't we just turn him over to Lando to fix?

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks at Han.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Not now, Chewie.  Lando, aren't you afraid the Empire might discover this little operation and shut you down?

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks his concern.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: No, I'm alright.  I'm alright.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks a doleful farewell.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'm sure I'll see you again, too. Keep well.  You'd better chain him until it's over.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks at his master.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: We should have stayed and finished them off.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks his agreement.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I don't care.  It would've been worth it .... for Han.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks his Òright on!Ó

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: ... the power?

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Howls.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks his consternation.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Chewie, head for the bottom of the city.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Okay, Chewie, it's now or never.

turns.speaker: CHEWIE
turns.text: Barks his agreement.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: ... Like we're being watched.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Away put your weapon.  I mean you no harm.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm looking for someone.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Looking?  Looking?  You've found someone I'd say.  Heh?  Yes!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Help you I can ... yes ... yes.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm looking for a great warrior.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: A great warrior?  Not many on those.  Wars don't make one great.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Listen, friend, we didn't mean to land here, and if I could get my fighter out of this puddle I would, but I can't.  So ...

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Can't get your ship out?  Have you tried?  Have you tried?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Give me that!

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Mine!  Mine!  Or I'll help you not.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I don't want your help.  I want my lamp back.  I'll need it in this slimy mudhole.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Mudhole?  Slimy?  My home this is.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Mine, mine.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Okay, Artoo, let him have it. Now get out of here, little fellow, we've got things to do.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: No, no!  I'll stay and help you find your friend.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm not looking for a friend. I'm looking for a Jedi Master.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Oh, a Jedi Master.  Different altogether.  Yoda you seek, Yoda.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You know the Jedi Master?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Of course, yes.  But now eat we must.  Good food, I have good food.  Come, come.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: ... I told you, I'm not hungry.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Patience.  It's time to eat.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Look, it smells good.  I'm sure it's delicious   But I don't know why we can't see Yoda now.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: It's the Jedi's time to eat, too.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Will it take long to get there? How far away is he?

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Not far, not far.  Be patient. Soon you will see him.  Why wish you become a Jedi?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Because of my father, I guess.

turns.speaker: CREATURE
turns.text: Oh, your father ... a powerful Jedi was he, powerful Jedi.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: How could you know my father? You don't even know who I am.  Can't we get on with this already?

turns.speaker: DECK SERGEANT
turns.text: Yes sir!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Sergeant, is Commander Skywalker back yet?

turns.speaker: DECK SERGEANT
turns.text: I haven't seen him.  He probably came in through the south entrance.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Probably isn't good enough, Sergeant. Check on it!

turns.speaker: DECK SERGEANT
turns.text: Commander Skywalker hasn't come through the south entrance, sir. Maybe he slipped by without checking in.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Not likely!  Where are the speeders?

turns.speaker: DECK SERGEANT
turns.text: We haven't got them adapted to this cold yet ...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: We'll have to go out on Tauntauns.

turns.speaker: DECK SERGEANT
turns.text: The temperature is dropping too fast.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You bet it is ... and Luke's out in it.

turns.speaker: DECK SERGEANT
turns.text: The night storms will start before you can reach the first marker.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Then I'll see you in Hell.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: What is thy bidding, My Master?

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: There is a grave disturbance in The Force.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: I have felt it.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Our situation is most precarious. We have a new enemy who could bring about our destruction.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Our destruction?  Who?

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: The son of Skywalker.  You must destroy him ... or he will be our undoing.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: He's not a Jedi, he's just a boy. Obi-wan could not have taught him so much that ...

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: You are weak!  I have seen it. The Force is strong with him. He must be destroyed.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: But, if he could be turned, he would be a powerful ally.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Yes ... yes.  That would be a great asset.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: He will join us or die, My Master.

turns.speaker: RIEEKAN
turns.text: Captain Solo.  What's the situation?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: There isn't a hint of life in the area.  But all the perimeter markers are set, so you'll know if anyone comes calling.

turns.speaker: RIEEKAN
turns.text: Good, and Commander Skywalker?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: He's checking out a meteorite that hit near him. He'll be in soon.

turns.speaker: RIEEKAN
turns.text: With all the meteor activity in this system, it's going to be difficult to spot approaching ships.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: The Empire won't look for you out here.  I'd say you're all set ... which means it's time for me to get going.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: RIEEKAN
turns.text: You're an extraordinary fighter. I hate to lose you.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Thank you, General.  But there's a price on my head.  If I don't pay off Jabba the Hutt, I'm a walking dead man.

turns.speaker: RIEEKAN
turns.text: I understand.  A death mark is not an easy thing to live with ... Until our paths cross again, may the force be with you.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Whatever it is, it isn't friendly. I'm going to have a look.  Come on, Chewie.

turns.speaker: RIEEKAN
turns.text: Wait.  I'll send a patrol with you.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Fine.  But they'll have to take care of themselves.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Captain Solo, sir. Might I have a word with you?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Mistress Leia has been trying to reach you on the communicator, but either you have it turned off, or it is malfunctioning ... if it's damaged, Artoo, could fix it, if you like.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I shut it off.  What's her royal holiness want?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: She is looking for Master Luke, and assumed he would be here with you.  No one seems to know ...

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I don't know, Artoo.  Sir, might I inquire what's going on?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Go tell your precious Princess ... Luke is dead unless he shows up soon.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: He doesn't make sense to me either, Chewie.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I do hope he's all there ... if you take my meaning.  I would hate to see Master Luke develop a short circuit ...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: The kid ran into something mean, and it wasn't the cold.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Transport XJ. get out of here. Go!

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: The energy shield is down.  We'll be stuck here forever.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Sir, I was wondering ...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Sit down, and shut up!

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: It can wait.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I think we're in trouble.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: If I may say so, Sir, I noticed earlier that the entire main para- light system seems to be damaged.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: We're in trouble!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: What are you so grouchy about?

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: Sir, I'm almost afraid to ask, but does shutting down all but emergency power systems include me?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You, too, golden rod.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I must admit there are times I don't understand human behavior.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: It sounds like it's trying to get in.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I'm going to see what it is.

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: We're doomed.  Goodbye, Mistress Leia.  Goodbye, Captain ...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Not collapsing, honey.  It's closing!  This is no cave ...

turns.speaker: THREEPIO
turns.text: I can see the edge of the asteroid field, sir.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Good.  Soon as we're clear, we'll kick this baby into hyperdrive.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Yes, Your Highness?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: You said you were going to stay. What happened?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That bounty hunter we ran into on Ord Mantell changed my mind.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Does Luke know?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: He'll know when he gets back ... Don't give me that look.  Every day more bounty hunters are searching for me.  If I don't pay off Jabba soon, there'll be too many to stop ... Remotes, Gank killers, and who knows what else.  I've got to get that price off my head while I still have a head.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Han, we need you here.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: We?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Not you?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Me?  I don't know what you mean.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You probably don't.  How could you?  You're so terrified of your own emotions ...

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: And what are they, pray tell?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You want me to stay because of the way you feel about me.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I respect you.  You're a bold fighter, maybe not the brightest, but ... HAN No, your worship.. That's not what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Am I?  I say you came running after me because you were afraid I was leaving you without even a kiss.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I'd just as soon kiss a wookiee.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: There's no accounting for taste. Believe me, you could use a good kiss.  You've spent so much time doing your duty and giving orders you've never learned how to be a woman. It's a shame, because you've got all the makings for one.  I could have helped you plenty in that department ... if you'd have let go for a minute.  But it's too late now, sweetheart.  Your big opportunity is flying out of here.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: We are fighting for a cause much ...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Spare me please!  Don't tell me about the Rebellion again.  I've had it with your noble mission. All you let yourself think about is the Rebellion.  The result is you're as cold as this planet.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: And you think you're the one to apply some heat?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Sure ... If I were interested. But I don't think it'd be much fun.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Those creatures he keeps talking about ... we'd better double the security ... Han, I don't know how ...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Now all we've got to worry about is what attacked him.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: No kidding.  If this snowball's got nasty natives, they could be anywhere.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: .... I'm afraid there's not much left.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Droid of some kind.  I didn't hit it that hard.  It must have had a self-destruct ....

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: An Imperial probe droid.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Now don't panic.  We don't know that.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Well, your worship, it looks like you arranged to keep me close by for a while longer.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I had nothing to do with it.  General Rieekan thinks it's dangerous for any ships to leave the system until we know where that probe came from.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I don't know what he's talking about.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Ooops!  I guess you haven't told Luke about that yet.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: You must have gone completely out of your feeble mind.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Come on, your highness, are you telling me you haven't been thinking about that kiss?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Why you low-down, stuck-up, half- witted, scruffy-looking nerf-herder.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Who's scruffy-looking?  I tell ya' sweetheart, I must've hit pretty close to the mark to get you hoppin' like this.  Doesn't it look that way to you, Luke?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Hey!  Someone's still in here.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Wait, don't open it ... that's one of the traps for the ice creatures.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Would it help if I got out and pushed?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Don't worry, your holiness, I'll get her started.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: This bucket of bolts is never going to get us past that blockade.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: This baby's got a few surprises left in her.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I'll be surprised if we ever start moving.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I know, I know, I see them ... LEIA See what?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Two more Star Destroyers heading right at us.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I'm glad you said there was going to be no problem, or I'd be worried.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That was no laser blast .... some- thing hit us ....

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Or you ran into something ....

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Asteroids!  Chewie, bank left, let's find out where they're coming from ...

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Probably an asteroid field ....

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Let's hope so ... it's just the chance we need.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: To get killed ... you're not seriously going into an asteroid field?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Aren't I?  Hang on, sweetheart. We're gonna do some flyin'.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Well, you said you wanted to be there when I was wrong.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I take it back.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That Star Destroyer is slowing down.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: But we're going to get pulverized if we stay out here much longer.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I'm against that.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: We've got to get out of this shower.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Now you're making sense.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Right.  I'm going to get in closer to one of these big ones ...

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: There, there.  Chewie get a reading on that.  Looks pretty good.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That should do nicely.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Why, Princess, this is so sudden.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Very funny.  You can let go now .... I'm getting angry.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You don't look angry.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: How do I look?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Beautiful.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Sorry, Captain, being held by you isn't enough to get me excited.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Well, I hope you don't expect more.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I don't expect anything, except to be left alone.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Fine with me.  But I'm afraid you'll have to let go.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That was no earthquake.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Felt like a hydro concussion ... an Imperial Cruiser.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: They're moving away.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: They're just trying to see if they can stir something up ... we're safe.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Where have I heard that before?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Easy, your worship.  Only trying to help.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Would you please stop calling me that?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Sure.  I guess I make it difficult sometimes.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Yes, you do.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You could be a touch warmer, though.  Admit it, against your better judgment you think I'm all right.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Sometimes, maybe ... occasionally, when you aren't acting like a scoundrel.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That's quite a compliment.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Stop that.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: What are you afraid of?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Afraid of?  Certainly not you Captain Solo ... or any other man in this galaxy.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Don't count on it.  I happen to like nice men.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Sure, they're safer.  You always know what they're going to do. Trouble is, it gets a little dull.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: There's nothing dull about a man I can depend on to be civilized.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You mean a man you can control.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I do not!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Try and control this ...

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: There's something out there!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Outside, in the cave.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Are you crazy!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Look, we just got this bucket going again.  I'm not about to let some varmint tear it apart ...

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Looks like some kind of Mynock.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: There will be more of them.  They always travel in groups.  And there's nothing they like better than to attach themselves to ships. Just what we need right now.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: Those Star Destroyers will spot us long before you can get into light speed.  You can't make the jump in this asteroid field.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Strap yourself in, sweetheart, we're taking off!

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: But the tremors have stopped.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I see it Chewie, hang on.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: The entrance is collapsing!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Couldn't be, I checked the transfer circuits, just like you said!  I tell you this time it's not my fault.  I'm sure I checked it.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: No lightspeed?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: It's not my fault.  I can't under- stand it!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Sharp bank, Chewie.  Let's turn this bucket around.  You heard me, turn around!  Full power on the front shield.

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: You're going to attack them?!!!

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: You could have warned him before you shut him off.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Oh, so sorry!  Didn't mean to offend your droid.  You think braking and shutting down in that amount of time is easy?

turns.speaker: LEIA
turns.text: I'm still not sure what you've accomplished.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Chewie, check the manual release on the landing claws.
